# Documentation Index

This directory contains comprehensive documentation for the gradle-dependency-plugin.

## üìö Documentation Files

### 1. [README.md](../README.md)
**Purpose**: Main plugin documentation  
**Audience**: Plugin users and consumers  
**Contents**:
- Quick start guide
- Feature overview
- Usage examples
- Troubleshooting guide

### 2. [DependencyPlugin-Explanation.md](./DependencyPlugin-Explanation.md)
**Purpose**: Detailed step-by-step code explanation  
**Audience**: Developers maintaining or learning the plugin  
**Contents**:
- Line-by-line code walkthrough
- Gradle API concepts explained
- Design decisions and rationale
- Usage examples with context

### 3. [development-rules.md](./development-rules.md)
**Purpose**: Hard rules and best practices for development  
**Audience**: Developers modifying the plugin  
**Contents**:
- Critical must-follow rules
- Code organization standards
- API usage guidelines
- Security and performance rules
- Emergency procedures

### 4. [copilot-instructions.md](./copilot-instructions.md)
**Purpose**: Guidelines for AI-assisted development  
**Audience**: Developers using GitHub Copilot  
**Contents**:
- Project principles and patterns
- Code style conventions
- Common patterns and anti-patterns
- Testing strategies
- Future enhancements

### 5. [quick-reference.md](./quick-reference.md)
**Purpose**: Quick lookup guide for common tasks  
**Audience**: All users  
**Contents**:
- Quick start commands
- Common patterns
- Troubleshooting checklist
- Build tasks reference
- Performance tips

## üóÇÔ∏è How to Use This Documentation

### As a Plugin User
1. Start with [README.md](../README.md) for overview
2. Reference [quick-reference.md](./quick-reference.md) for common tasks
3. Check [DependencyPlugin-Explanation.md](./DependencyPlugin-Explanation.md) for deep understanding

### As a Plugin Developer
1. Read [DependencyPlugin-Explanation.md](./DependencyPlugin-Explanation.md) to understand the code
2. Follow [development-rules.md](./development-rules.md) when making changes
3. Use [copilot-instructions.md](./copilot-instructions.md) for coding patterns
4. Update documentation when adding features

### For Troubleshooting
1. Check [quick-reference.md](./quick-reference.md) troubleshooting section
2. Review [development-rules.md](./development-rules.md) emergency procedures
3. Consult [DependencyPlugin-Explanation.md](./DependencyPlugin-Explanation.md) for technical details

### For AI/Copilot Usage
1. Reference [copilot-instructions.md](./copilot-instructions.md) for patterns
2. Follow [development-rules.md](./development-rules.md) for standards
3. Use [DependencyPlugin-Explanation.md](./DependencyPlugin-Explanation.md) for context

## üìù Documentation Maintenance

### When to Update

| Trigger | Update These Files |
|---------|-------------------|
| New feature added | README.md, quick-reference.md, copilot-instructions.md |
| API change | DependencyPlugin-Explanation.md, development-rules.md |
| New rule discovered | development-rules.md |
| Common issue found | quick-reference.md (troubleshooting) |
| Version update | All files (version references) |

### Update Checklist
- [ ] Code explanation matches current implementation
- [ ] Rules reflect current best practices
- [ ] Examples are tested and working
- [ ] Version numbers are updated
- [ ] Links are valid
- [ ] Troubleshooting is current

## üéØ Documentation Quality Standards

All documentation should be:
- ‚úÖ **Accurate**: Reflects current implementation
- ‚úÖ **Complete**: Covers all important aspects
- ‚úÖ **Clear**: Easy to understand
- ‚úÖ **Concise**: No unnecessary verbosity
- ‚úÖ **Consistent**: Uses standard terminology
- ‚úÖ **Current**: Updated with code changes
- ‚úÖ **Actionable**: Provides concrete examples
